The aeroplane uses fuel in the following order:
 Each engine feeds from the inner tank of the wing (Left engine feeds from Left Inner Tank; Right Engine from Right Inner Tank)
 When the inner tanks have 4000 Kg then the Trim Tank tranfers all its contents equally to the Inner Tanks.
 When the Inner Tanks have 3500 Kg then the Outer tanks tranfer their contents to the Inner Tanks via Transfer Valves.
 Fuel state: Outer Tanks FULL     Trim Tank FULL
 During the flight the Trim Tank transfer pump fails when the total fuel on board is 18620 Kg
 What is the Aeroplanes Total Endurance if the fuel consumption is 96 Kg /Min

The aeroplane uses fuel in the following order:
 Each engine feeds from the inner tank of the wing (Left engine feeds from Left Inner Tank; Right Engine from Right Inner Tank)
 When the inner tanks have 4000 Kg then the Trim Tank tranfers all its contents equally to the Inner Tanks.
 When the Inner Tanks have 3500 Kg then the Outer tanks tranfer their contents to the Inner Tanks via Transfer Valves.
 During the flight when the fuel quantity reaches 12730 Kg the Left wing Transfer Valve fails to open.
 What is the Endurance if the Fuel Flow is 5420 Kg?

The aeroplane uses fuel in the following order:
Each engine feeds from the inner tank of the wing (Left engine feeds from Left Inner Tank; Right Engine from Right Inner Tank)
When the inner tanks have 4000 Kg then the Trim Tank tranfers all its contents equally to the Inner Tanks.
When the Inner Tanks have 3500 Kg then the Outer tanks tranfer their contents to the Inner Tanks via Transfer Valves.
During the flight when the fuel quantity reaches 12730 Kg the Left wing Transfer Valve fails to open.
What is the remaining Endurance for the Right Engine if the Fuel Flow is 5420 Kg?

While en-route a passenger gets ill and a doctor on board says that the plane should land at the nearest suitable airfield. The FMC calculates a flight time of 26 minutes and gives a gross mass of 78 200 kg. The fuel on board is 9 200 kg and the FMC gives a fuel on landing of 8 700 kg. What will be the landing mass?

Consider an airplane with 3 fuel tanks: left, right and centre. Left and right fuel tank capacity = 205 kg each, centre = 600 kg. The left fuel tank is connected to the left engine and the right fuel tank is connected to the right engine. A pump connected to the centre tank is feeding the left and right fuel tank.
At take-off there were 600kg of fuel. The consumption is of 125 kg/h per engine and after 35 min of flight, the pump fails. What is the endurance from that moment?
